programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: Playoff contenders meet as the No. 3 Crimson Tide host the No. 11 Longhorns. Then-No. 1 Alabama needed a late field goal to squeak past Texas 20-19 last season. Jalen Milroe totaled five TDs in Alabama's 56-7 win over Middle Tennessee in Week 1.

programme.title: College Football Scoreboard
programme.desc: Presenting up-to-the-minute scores and highlights during the college football season.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Golden Bears begin their home slate with a date against the Tigers. California scored six rushing touchdowns in a season-opening 58-21 romp at North Texas on Sept. 2. The Hugh Freeze era began at Auburn with a 59-14 rout of UMass that same day.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: College Football Final
programme.desc: Once the day's slate of college football games is complete, ESPN recaps the action and discusses its implications on the top 25. Matt Barrie hosts with analysts Joey Galloway and Dan Mullen.

programme.title: NFL Matchup
programme.desc: An NFL Films production, "NFL Matchup" is definitely a show for football junkies. Unlike traditional football preview programs, this one gives fans an in-depth look at some of Sunday's games by breaking down the strategy and tactics -- the Xs and Os -- through the exclusive use of team-supplied footage. That type of film study is a forte of former NFL player and executive Louis Riddick and NFL Films producer Greg Cosell, whose work is featured here alongside host Sal Paolantonio.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: Playoff contenders meet as the No. 3 Crimson Tide host the No. 11 Longhorns. Then-No. 1 Alabama needed a late field goal to squeak past Texas 20-19 last season. Jalen Milroe totaled five TDs in Alabama's 56-7 win over Middle Tennessee in Week 1.

Unlike traditional football preview programs, this one gives fans an in-depth look at some of Sunday's games by breaking down the strategy and tactics -- the Xs and Os -- through the exclusive use of team-supplied footage. programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Sunday NFL Countdown
programme.desc: This Sunday pregame staple debuted in 1985 and soon became a signature ESPN series. Host Samantha Ponder introduces the features and directs the storylines associated with the day's games, joined by a roster of analysts highlighted by ex-NFL players, coaches and executives including Tedy Bruschi, Randy Moss, Matt Hasselbeck, Rex Ryan and Louis Riddick. Chris Mortensen and Adam Schefter deliver breaking news and injury updates, while reporters at game sites set the scenes.

programme.title: 2023 U.S. Open Tennis
programme.desc: From the USTA Billie Jean King National Tennis Center in Flushing, N.Y.

programme.title: 2023 U.S. Open Men's Final Pre-Show
programme.desc: Pre-match analysis for the U.S. Open Men's Final.

programme.title: 2023 U.S. Open Tennis
programme.desc: Novak Djokavic vs. Daniil Medvedev.

programme.title: Baseball Tonight: Sunday Night Countdown
programme.desc: Leading into each of ESPN's Sunday Night Baseball telecasts is this special edition of "Baseball Tonight." Host Karl Ravech teams with analysts and reporters to present fans a detailed preview of the network's exclusive, national game of the week. Highlights of the day's other games, interviews with players and managers, and key storylines from around the league also fill the hourlong show. Mark Teixeira, Eduardo PÃ©rez, Tim Kurkjian and Buster Olney are among the analysts.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Peter Lambert takes a turn for the Rockies in this three-game series finale against the Giants. Lambert, who worked his way back to the majors after missing most of 2022, has yet to earn a decision in three career starts against San Francisco.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Golden Bears begin their home slate with a date against the Tigers. California scored six rushing touchdowns in a season-opening 58-21 romp at North Texas on Sept. 2. The Hugh Freeze era began at Auburn with a 59-14 rout of UMass that same day.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee brings his humor and candor to the microphone to highlight the day's top stories.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Monday Blitz
programme.desc: A fast-paced offering that blends the NFL and college football while focusing on the weekend that was and broader topics; includes moments and significant achievements from all levels of football, such as high school, youth and flag football.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.title: Monday Night Countdown
programme.desc: Previewing the Monday Night Football matchup airing later on ESPN. Host Scott Van Pelt is joined by Ryan Clark, Robert Griffin III, Marcus Spears, Adam Schefter and Michelle Beisner-Buck as they analyze every last morsel of information pertaining to Monday night's combatants, plus discuss the latest news that developed out of Sunday's action.

programme.title: NFL Football
programme.desc: Aaron Rodgers makes his Jets debut as the AFC East rival Bills visit the Meadowlands. Rodgers, a four-time MVP, was traded to New York in April after spending his first 18 seasons with Green Bay. Buffalo is the three-time defending AFC East champion.

programme.title: Monday Night Postgame
programme.desc: Analysts dissect the Monday Night Football action.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." programme.title: The Pulse: Texas A&M Football
programme.desc: "The Pulse: Texas A&M Football" is an all-access pass to Jimbo Fisher and the Aggies team, all from the comfort of your living room. The 12th Man Productions team takes you behind the scenes of Aggie football -- from the hard work put in on the practice fields and in-game emotions to locker room speeches and off-the-field fun. "The Pulse" walks you through the week-by-week lives of the Aggie football players. The 30-minute show premieres every game week throughout the season. Fisher and his staff embrace the grind as they prepare for another season in the SEC.

programme.title: 2023 FIBA Basketball World Cup
programme.desc: From SM Mall of Asia Arena in Quezon City, Metro Manila, Philippines.

programme.title: Daily Wager
programme.desc: Doug Kezirian joins sports betting experts as well as ESPN analysts and reporters from various sports for discussion centered on analytics and point spreads as well as how the day's sports news affects betting.

programme.title: Fantasy Football Now
programme.desc: "Fantasy Football Now" airs live on Sunday mornings during the NFL season, a time when fans are making last-minute roster moves and need the latest news from around the league. Providing the latest info are host Field Yates, analysts Mike Clay and Damien Woody, and senior writer and injury analyst Stephania Bell. Also contributing to the show are ESPN's NFL reporters, who bring fantasy players the latest intel from game sites and, in many cases, straight from the coach's mouth to give fantasy owners everything they need to know to set their lineups.

programme.title: Women's College Volleyball
programme.desc: From L&N Federal Credit Union Arena in Louisville, Ky.

programme.title: WNBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Aces and Mercury end their contrasting regular seasons by ending a home-and-home set. Las Vegas aims to clinch a second straight top-overall seed entering the WNBA's playoffs, which Phoenix will miss for the first time since 2012.

programme.title: X Games California 2023
programme.desc: Coverage from the annual action sports event. From Southern California.

programme.desc: Previews, highlights and stories involving events and athletes from the X Games.

programme.title: UFC Ultimate Knockouts
programme.desc: Memorable knock-outs from throughout MMA history.

programme.title: UFC Main Events
programme.desc: Valentina Shevchenko takes on Holly Holm, from July 23, 2016.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Bears look to bounce back as they host the No. 12 Utes in Week 2. Baylor dropped its opener 42-31 as Texas State earned its first victory over a Power Five school. Utah converted a 14-point halftime lead into a 24-11 win over Florida on Aug. 31.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Peter Lambert takes a turn for the Rockies in this three-game series finale against the Giants. Lambert, who worked his way back to the majors after missing most of 2022, has yet to earn a decision in three career starts against San Francisco.

programme.desc: Start the day off right with Chris Canty, Evan Cohen and Michelle Smallmon providing an energizing and informative way to take on the day. Sports, life and laughter are what it's all about.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: In-depth, comprehensive daily coverage of all aspects of the NBA from expert analysts.

programme.title: Pressure: Xander Zayas & Bruce Carrington
programme.desc: Xander Zayas and Bruce Carrington head to the ring.

programme.title: UFC: The Walk
programme.desc: An in-depth look at Valentina Shevchenko and Jessica Eye and their journeys to the Octagon ahead of UFC 238.

programme.title: UFC Top 10
programme.desc: A look at the top 10 upsets in the UFC.

programme.title: Unsportsmanlike with Evan, Canty and Michelle
programme.desc: Start the day off right with Chris Canty, Evan Cohen and Michelle Smallmon providing an energizing and informative way to take on the day. Sports, life and laughter are what it's all about.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: College Football Live
programme.desc: Want to know up-to-the-minute reports about your favorite college football team? ESPN has it covered with this weekday studio show, a roundtable format that emphasizes discussion and opinions on the sport's biggest stories and newsmakers. The half-hour program features a rotating roster of analysts that includes coaches, former players, and media personalities.

programme.title: College Football Live
programme.desc: Want to know up-to-the-minute reports about your favorite college football team? ESPN has it covered with this weekday studio show, a roundtable format that emphasizes discussion and opinions on the sport's biggest stories and newsmakers. The half-hour program features a rotating roster of analysts that includes coaches, former players, and media personalities.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee brings his humor and candor to the microphone to highlight the day's top stories.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.title: NFL's Greatest Games
programme.desc: From Feb. 12, 2023.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Knights journey north to play the Broncos. UCF began life in the Big 12 with a 50-point beatdown of Kent State on Aug. 31. Boise State fell at then-No. 10 Washington. UCF erased a 17-point deficit to come back and beat Boise State 36-31 in 2021.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Sun Devils try to even the score against the Cowboys. In 2022, Oklahoma State pulled away from Arizona State late to secure a 34-17 double-up. Three quarterbacks checked into Oklahoma State's 27-13 win over Central Arkansas on Sept. 2.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: An old-school rivalry pits the Cornhuskers against the No. 22 Buffaloes. The Deion Sanders era in Colorado began with a stunning 45-42 upset of then-No. 17 TCU in Week 1. His son Shedeur threw for a school-record 510 yards with four TD passes.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: Iowa State hosts its nemesis Iowa. In 2022, the Cyclones claimed the Cy-Hawk Trophy for the first time in eight years with an upset victory in Iowa City. Iowa State capped off a 21-play, 99-yard drive with a touchdown, securing a gritty 10-7 triumph.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The No. 6 Trojans and Cardinal meet for their final regular-season Pac-12 matchup in this Week 2 contest. The ACC voted to add Stanford to its roster Sept. 1, just hours before the Cardinal opened their season with a 37-24 win at Hawaii. USC is 2-0.

programme.desc: Coverage of motorcycle racing action from around the world.

programme.title: NASCAR RaceDay
programme.desc: Race fans and drivers count on NASCAR RaceDay to get them ready for the big NASCAR Cup Series race, bringing them the inside story and up-to-the-minute news in a lighthearted and fun manner.

programme.title: 2021 NBA Finals
programme.desc: The Bucks seek their first title since 1971 when they play the Suns in Game 6 of the NBA Finals. Milwaukee took a 3-2 series lead with a 123-119 triumph at Phoenix. The Bucks' Jrue Holiday had 27 points, 13 assists and three steals in that game.

programme.title: NBA 75: 75 Stories
programme.desc: Profiles of Giannis Antetokounmpo, Rick Barry and Wes Unseld.

programme.title: NBA 75: The Celebration
programme.desc: The NBA celebrates its 75th season of professional basketball action.

programme.title: The Big O
programme.desc: The storied career of professional basketball player Oscar Robertson.

programme.title: NBA Playoff Playback
programme.desc: The Bucks withstand Kevin Durant's NBA-record 48 points in a Game 7, beating the Nets 115-111. Giannis Antetokounmpo has 40 points and 13 rebounds, and Khris Middleton makes the tiebreaking shot with 40 seconds left in OT. From June 19, 2021.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: Giannis Antetokounmpo had 43 points, 14 rebounds and 5 assists as the Bucks went on a lopsided run in the third quarter and beat the Nets 110-99. Kevin Durant and Kyrie Irving combined for 60 points in defeat. From Oct. 26, 2022.

programme.title: High Tops
programme.desc: We highlight the top plays from the 2022-23 season.

programme.title: Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: Western Conference Semifinals, Game 3. Kareem Abdul-Jabbar leads all scorers with 28 points but it wasn't enough to overcome Mark Aguirre (27 points) and the Dallas Mavericks, who beat the Lakers 108-110. From May 2, 1986.

programme.title: Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: Tim Duncan leads all scorers with 41 points but it wasn't enough to overcome Dirk Nowitzki, 37 points, and the Dallas Mavericks who beat the Spurs 119-111 in overtime to win the 2006 Western Conference semifinals.

programme.title: Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: Dirk Nowitzki hit 10 of his first 11 shots and an NBA playoff-record 24 straight free throws on the way to 48 points, leading the Dallas Mavericks to a 121-112 victory over the Oklahoma City Thunder in Game 1 of the Western Conference finals.

programme.title: USA Basketball: A Team for the Ages
programme.desc: The 2020 women's Olympic team looks to win a record 7th consecutive Olympic gold medal. Follow head coach Dawn Staley and a cast of the world's greatest women basketball players from training camp in Las Vegas through the gold medal game in Tokyo.

programme.title: WNBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Liberty and Mystics play one more postseason tune-up with this regular-season finale. New York enters the playoffs as a heavy favorite to reach the WNBA Finals after adding former MVPs Breanna Stewart and Jonquel Jones prior to the season.

programme.title: Title IX: 37 Words that Changed America
programme.desc: Candace Parker takes a personal look at the past, present and future of Title IX and the drive for equality in sports. Chronicles and celebrates the societal and cultural impact of Title IX, anchored through the perspective of Parker.

programme.title: WNBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Liberty and Mystics play one more postseason tune-up with this regular-season finale. New York enters the playoffs as a heavy favorite to reach the WNBA Finals after adding former MVPs Breanna Stewart and Jonquel Jones prior to the season.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: Luka Doncic had a franchise-record 60 points, with 21 rebounds and 10 assists, the first 60-20-10 game in NBA history, as the Mavericks rallied for a wild 126-121 victory over the New York Knicks. From Dec. 27, 2022.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: Luka Doncic scored 42 points, Kyrie Irving added 40 and the new All-Star pairing sparkled throughout the Mavericks' 133-126 victory over the 76ers. Doncic won a matchup of the NBA's top two scorers. From March 2, 2023.

programme.title: Shaqtin' a Fool
programme.desc: Shaq takes a look back at the first half of the 2022-23 NBA Season.

programme.title: Shaqtin' a Fool
programme.desc: Shaq takes a look back at the 2022-23 NBA Season.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: Luka Doncic hit tying 3-pointers in the final seconds of regulation and the first overtime, finishing with 35 points, 14 rebounds and 13 assists in the Dallas Mavericks' 119-115 double-overtime victory over the Los Angeles Lakers. From Jan. 12, 2023.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: Maxi Kleber drilled the winning 3-pointer at the buzzer on a crosscourt pass from Kyrie Irving, who scored 38 points in the Mavericks' stunning 111-110 victory over the Lakers. From March 17, 2023.

programme.title: NBA Finals Film Room
programme.desc: Jason Kidd, Jason Terry, Brendan Haywood and Caron Butler offer insights and commentary throughout Game 6 of the 2011 NBA Finals.

programme.title: 2011 NBA Finals
programme.desc: Jason Terry steps up with 27 points to lead Dallas to its first championship. From June 12, 2011.

programme.title: Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: Chris Paul's 22 points and 10 assists are too much for Carmelo Anthony and the Nuggets. From Nov. 27, 2008.

programme.title: On This Day
programme.desc: Jamal Mashburn ends a 50-point performance by grabbing his own rebound and sinking a short jumper with 1 second left in overtime to lift the New Orleans Hornets to a 125-123 victory over the Memphis Grizzlies. From Feb. 21, 2003.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: Chris Paul had 24 points, 15 assists and 11 rebounds, and the Hornets held on for a 99-94 victory over the Dallas Mavericks to win their first-round series in five games.

programme.title: Game of the Day
programme.desc: Zion Williamson scores 31 points while dominating inside, and the New Orleans Pelicans end a three-game skid with a 144-113 victory over the Memphis Grizzlies. From Feb. 16, 2021.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: Brandon Ingram and Zion Williamson each score 30 points and the New Orleans Pelicans overcome another triple-double by Nikola Jokic to beat the Denver Nuggets, 113-108. From March 21, 2021.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: From Dec. 22, 2022.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: From March 30, 2023.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: Zion Williamson scored a career-high 43 points, capping it with New Orleans' final 14 points in the last 2:44 of the game, and the Pelicans narrowly outlasted the Minnesota Timberwolves 119-118 for their fourth straight victory. From Dec. 28, 2022.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: Zion Williamson scored 35 points for a second straight game, and the New Orleans Pelicans beat the short-handed Phoenix Suns, 129-124, in overtime for their seventh straight victory. From Dec. 11, 2022.
